lexUnit.name: shake.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to tremble or vibrate or move something forcefully up and down or back and forth.

sentence.text: For the second time that day , Corbett was shaken awake , an insistent voice calling his name .
The next morning Benjamin shook me awake .
Fedorov clambered aboard the coach and shook the reins .
Replace the bottle stopper and shake the solution thoroughly .
Frustrated , Delaney shook Lawton by the arm .
I shook my sand-filled ears by the lobes and listened .
Luke reached out and shook her gently by the shoulders .
Duvall was shaking him by the sleeve , bringing him back .
The words were enough to make him explode with anger , and , turning swiftly to grip her shoulders , he shook her with force , glaring down into her face .
She spread hay over him for warmth , but it seemed as if the fever would shake him to pieces .
` Good morning , " she greeted huskily , shaking the boots before putting them on .
Athelstan shook himself , dressed , and went along to the kitchen to beg from a startled maid a bowl of hot water , a clean napkin and some salt with which to scrub his teeth .
The wind was screaming and shaking the big windows , and Thomasin Darling had to shout .
Again she was shaken by uncontrollable spasms .
When the time comes to recover the gold , the ripples are removed and the carpet is shaken .
The dog gets up and shakes his ears noisily .
Vasili shook her shoulders violently then slapped her across the face .
